description: Copied A.H. 564 [?] [A.D. 1169] by ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻĪsá ibn ʻUbayd Allāh ibn ʻĪsá al-Murādī al-Andulusī al-Ishbīli. Fols. 203; 22 x 15.3 cm.; written surface 16 x 11 cm.; 18 lines to page; on glazed Arabic paper; in naskhi. The fifth part of a commentary on the Koran exegeting Sūrahs XVII - XXIII. According to Ibn Khallikān, Wafayāt (1299 AH), I, p. 537 this is one of the best commentaries on the Koran. Beg.: بسم الله الرحمن الرحىم ... تفسىر سورة بني اسرائىل Colophon: فرغ منه صاحبه الفقىر الى رحمت [رحمة] الله عبدالله بن عىسى بن عبىد الله بن عىسى المرادي الاندلسي ثم الاشبىلي في الثالث من شعبان سنة اربع وستىن وخمسمائة حامدًا الله تعالى مصلىا على رسوله محمد صلى الله علىه وعلى آله واصحابه وزوجته A few marginal notes. Ibn Khallikān attributes this work to Abū al-Qāsim al-Qushayrī A.H. 376-465 [A.D. 986-1072], but in the present MS his son al-Qushayrī Abū Naṣr appears as the author. MS in fair condition; worm-eaten; Arabic binding with flap. MS is rare. Acquired from Brill, Leyden, A.D. 1900. Ibn Khallikān, Wafayāt (1299 AH), I, p. 537; ḥājjī Khalīfah, Kashf al-ẓunūn (1835-58), II, p. 487.
